sent_question: he enjoys walking in the woods alone?
two but not three of the weekends were sunny?
the movies were not always funny?
he did not love the student?
not all of the cookies were chocolate?
the player was not both skillful and hardworking?
sent_manipulation: John spends a lot of time with his family.
Bob doesn't usually pay attention to the weather.
Bob cares about his students and keeps in touch with them.
Bob has never been to the bakery before.
Bob has no interest in fashion or clothes.
John has only seen one or two football games.
sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
Bob and John were talking about the weather during the previous month.
Yesterday, John and Bob were talking about the movies at a local theater.
A year ago, Bob and John were talking about a  student in a class they taught.
A few days ago, John and Bob were talking about cookies at a local bakery.
Last month, Bob and John were talking about a shirt at a local store.
Last week, John and Bob were talking about a player in a recent football game.
expt_aim: trying to figure out what comments mean in context and whether certain wording implies a certain meaning
sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
Two of the weekends were sunny.
Some of the cookies were chocolate.
The player was skillful or hardworking.
